On the premise that a true workshop were desirable and possible with respect to
availability of funds and resource persons, I would like to suggest the follow¬
ing o
Not everybody is primarily interested in the same things* Neither are they
at the same level of experience and understanding* Going to a conference
or workshop of this kind is not unlike reading an issue of Electronics
magazine, A few articles are of prime interest, some are of secondary
interest, others are of no interest at all.
So, it would be desirable to have an elementary section and an advanced
section of the group* Also it would be nice to have two or three fields
of activity in operation simultaneously thus giving the participant a
selection to fit his particular interests and needs and allow him to re¬
ject that which doesn«t particularly concern him* This procedure will
break the group down to smaller groups and thus alleviate the problem
of large groups actually operating limited equipment* It will also pro¬
